docs.title: MkDocs Data Plugin
docs.text: MkDocs Data Plugin is a plugin for MkDocs that allows reading data from separate external markup files and use it in your Markdown pages.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
When using this plugin, you can define data in YAML or JSON files in a separate directory and reference it in your Markdown pages.

root/
├── docs/
│   └── ...
├── data/
│   └── fruits.yml
└── mkdocs.yml
fruits.yml
- Apple
- Banana
- Strawberry

Files in this directory can be referenced in your Markdown files using the data variable.

{% for fruit in data.fruits -%}
- {{ fruit }}
{% endfor %}
  • Apple
  • Banana
  • Strawberry

docs.title: Supported Formats
docs.text:
The plugin supports the following file formats:

  • JSON: .json
  • YAML: .yml, .yaml

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
This plugin can be installed via pip:

pip install mkdocs-data-plugin

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
To use the plugin, add the following lines to your mkdocs.yml:

plugins:
  - macros
  - data

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Aside from Python and MkDocs, the plugin has the following dependencies:

  • mkdocs-macros-plugin: Needed to provide the data variable in pages.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: This plugin provides the following configuration options.

docs.title: Data Directory
docs.text:
The data_dir option specifies the directory where data files are stored. By default, this is set to data.

plugins:
  - data:
      data_dir: data

Tip

It is recommended to configure the watch option in the mkdocs.yml file to automatically reload the site when data files are modified.

watch:
  - data
